descriptionSet.description: A woman farmer stands holding a sickle in her left hand and a handful of paddy in her right hand. In the background a field in which women and men are working can be seen. Sacks of grain, a threshing machine and tractor can be seen.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

hra:item.hra:value: Raja, H. R.
text-en: H. R. Raja

description-en: A woman farmer stands holding a sickle in her left hand and a handful of paddy in her right hand. In the background a field in which women and men are working can be seen. Sacks of grain, a threshing machine and tractor can be seen. (gs/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: In posters of rural landscapes, buxom farm girls reap rich harvests made possible by the modern tractors, threshing machines and irrigation pumps; here work surrounds and gives meaning to the village beauty, making her, as Patricia Uberoi has argued, a sensuous evocation of Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth and fertility. In images of the modern home, by contrast, work has disappeared. The promise seems to be that the mistress of a modern house is not unduly occupied by that work; she either has servants carefully out of sight, or housekeeping has become so effortless as to take up little of her time. (Abigail McGowan)(gs)
